text: Jock's Lodge railway station served the area of Jock's Lodge, Edinburgh, Scotland from 1847 to 1848 on the Waverley Route and the East Coast Main Line. == History == This short lived station opened in September 1847 by the North British Railway. It was only open for 10 months, closing on 1 July 1848. == References == == External links == Category:Disused railway stations in Edinburgh Category:Railway stations in Great Britain opened in 1847 Category:Railway stations in Great Britain closed in 1848 Category:Former North British Railway stations Category:1847 establishments in Scotland Category:1848 disestablishments in Scotland
title: Jock's Lodge railway station
